meanings.definition: To belch or emit gas from the stomach through the mouth.
meanings.sent1: After drinking soda quickly, he started eructing loudly at the party.
meanings.sent2: The man felt embarrassed after eructing in the quiet library.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed surprised by the sudden eructing noise coming from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The volcano was eructing ash and smoke into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The old car engine was eructing black smoke, signaling a problem.

meanings.definition: To discharge or emit something violently or explosively.
meanings.sent1: The pressure built up in the container, eventually eructing its contents all over the room.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display ended with a grand finale, eructing colorful sparks into the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The balloon unexpectedly eructing confetti, surprising everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The geyser in the park was eructing hot water high into the air.
meanings.sent5: The factory chimney was eructing thick smoke, polluting the air around it.
